Package noteApp.utils.AES

Class Crypter

  • java.lang.Object
    • noteApp.utils.AES.Crypter
  • public class Crypter
extends java.lang.Object
    Encrypts/decrypts text with AES128
    Author:
    Jere Salmensaari

      • encryptAES128

        public java.lang.String encryptAES128​(java.lang.String note,
                                      java.lang.String secret)
        Encrypts a given string using an AES 128 algorithm and a secret key that is 128 bits of length
        Parameters:
        note - Note to encrypt.
        secret - 128bit or 16Byte secret key.
        Returns:
        encrypted string.

      • encrypt

        private void encrypt​(int[] state,
                     int[] key)
        Encrypting main loop in AES128.
        Parameters:
        state - current part of data to encrypt.
        key - expanded key.

      • subBytes

        private void subBytes​(int[] input)
        SubBytes step of AES encryption. Changes all bytes in the array to ones corresponding in s-box.
        Parameters:
        input - array of 16 bytes.

      • shiftRows

        private void shiftRows​(int[] input)
        Shifts rows from original position to [00, 04, 08, 12] [05, 09, 13, 01] [10, 14, 02, 06] [15, 03, 07, 11]
        Parameters:
        input - Array to shift.

      • mixColumns

        private void mixColumns​(int[] input)
        Performs a Galoir field matrix multiplication on input
        Parameters:
        input - array of 16 bytes

      • addRoundKey

        private void addRoundKey​(int[] input,
                         int[] key)
        AddRoundKey step of AES. Performs XOR addition of key into state.
        Parameters:
        input - Current state.
        key - Key.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • removePadding

        private int[] removePadding​(int[] input)
        Removes padding from the end of decrypted text.
        Parameters:
        input - input array of 16 bytes with padding to remove.
        Returns:
        array of bytes with padding removed.
